content:
Check:
  all:
    - any:
        - name: --ORRES
          operator: non_empty
        - name: --DRVFL
          operator: equal_to
          value: Y
    - all:
        - name: --STRESC
          operator: empty
Core:
  Id: CORE-000021
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when the value for --STRESC is null.
Outcome:
  Message: --STRESC should not be blank when either --ORRES is provided or --DRVFL
    = 'Y' .
  Output Variables:
    - --ORRES
    - --DRVFL
    - --STRESC
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0397
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Model v2.0[Findings][The standardized result of the
                  measurement, test, or examination in character format. --STRESC
                  should store all results or findings in character format; if results
                  are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in --STRESN.
                  If various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in --ORRES
                  and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could
                  be represented in standard format in --STRESC as "NEGATIVE".]|IG
                  v3.4[6.3.5.3][Contains the result value for all findings, copied
                  or derived from LBORRES in a standard format or standard units.]
                Document: Model v2.0|IG v3.4
                Section: Findings|6.3.5.3
                Item: Specification
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raise an error when the value for --STRESC is null.

Outcome.Message: --STRESC should not be blank when either --ORRES is provided or --DRVFL = 'Y' .

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Model v2.0[Findings][The standardized result of the measurement, test, or examination in character format. --STRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in --STRESN. If various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in --ORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in --STRESC as "NEGATIVE".]|IG v3.4[6.3.5.3][Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from LBORRES in a standard format or standard units.]
